text: I am not a fan of american mexican food, good thing they don't serve that fare here. The taquitos take me back to the streets of tijuana without the risk of "after effects" :)
The call center is a marvel of communication, with hold times that encourage deep introspection. The agents’ politeness adds an ironic touch to every unresolved query.
The outdoor seating area is so inviting, and the staff was friendly. If only the dessert didn’t taste like pure disappointment in sugar form.
The gift shop is a treasure trove of items you’ll never need. The pricing ensures you’ll leave with nothing but the memory of overambitious retail.
Such strange combinations of flavors, yet they taste so good.  We've been here three or four times and are never disappointed.
Loved the scenic restaurant, right in the middle of the farm. My #1 spot for a weekend brunch.

This gas station is a marvel of modern design, with pumps that give you enough time to read a novel while filling your tank. The restrooms add a rustic charm that takes you back to simpler, dirtier times.
It was great coming to this store. It has a large selection of trendy clothes.  I will come back again.
great 3D Imax theater,,,see the Transformers...very spectacular
The restaurant’s tasting menu is a true culinary adventure, with flavors so subtle they’re almost imperceptible. The service is as light as the seasoning on the dishes.
Great food and service. Normally a wait on the weekend, but what would you expect.
Great place to shop for suits, ties, and dress clothes at reasonable prices.
Chicken schnitzel was amazing. Service was slow and server didn't know the menu. Didn't know what a knish was.
This is my neighborhood grocery store. It's at the two locations I shop at most. It's always clean and well stocked and I never have to wait in line for very long.
The ambiance was charming; the food, not so much.
The desserts were so sweet, they might’ve been pure sugar.

...for selling broccoli at a good price I gave them a chance.
...for selling celery that was already rotting I won't do so again.
I absolutely adore the way they serve soup lukewarm; it's so edgy.
Friendly service but food was just ok. Maybe an off night.
Loved the winkie!  Eat your vegan meal next door at Green and stroll over to Nami for dessert.
Food is outstanding! Rebecca rocks!!!!!!
Awesome place. Staff is very helpfull!
Great breakfast!  The rest of the menu however is average.
These guys know their stuff.  Professional staff and great location.
Great atmosphere and food. We keep coming back!

Great bread and sandwiches. 

Nimrod employees.
Great for young kids... tons to do and see
Great fried fish and crispy onion rings....yum!
The desserts were so sweet, they hurt more than they pleased.
The dessert was so sweet, it tasted like regret.
This place is old but the food is good. The compliments arent that great...such as the basil and bean sprouts they give out. Their soy milk is made fresh and does not come from a Yeo's can.
Just perfect !!!  For what it is!!!  Down to the Edison light bulbs from rejuvanation!!
Excellent staff. Always knows how to make my drinks. Always remembers my orders every time I come in too.
My family has been going to Dr. Brittan for 10 years.  He is an excellent dentist and can handle any situation you can throw at him.
Ditto what Kristi M. said.  Thank you to my fellow Yelpers for helping me find this place.
The cheesy breadsticks were delicious.  Everything else, not so much.
Pizza crust & toppings are excellent. However the pizza sauce was too salty. I'm willing to try again later.
Have eaten here several times.  Always amazing.
Amazing sandwhich joint. A must go place to eat!
A meal here is like a mystery novel, where every bite raises more questions.
I crave their jalapeno fried rice. AMAZING!

I don't get what people like about this place. It's generally crowded with rushed service and the food has yet to impress. I've tried at least twice -- maybe I'm ordering wrong but I really just don't get it...
The ambiance was charming, if you enjoy chaos.
Dr. Jones was very friendly and understanding!
Cheap and delicious!  Can't beat that.
Dining here is an experience you’ll laugh about later, though not while eating.
Their take on spicy food is admirable; it’s not spicy or food.
The bar’s acoustics are perfect for highlighting nearby conversations, not the music.
The burger was hilariously small, perfect for a dollhouse.
The cocktails are so creative, they’re more water than drink.
The salad was so creative, I didn’t even recognize the ingredients.
The gas station is an ode to inefficiency, ensuring every visit feels like a time capsule.
Had just gotten off a long flight and wondered into Aunt Chiladas for the first time.  Loved the food and the margaritas !!  Will go back again.
The car wash transforms your vehicle into an abstract art piece, with streaks and spots that rival any modern masterpiece. The attention to detail ensures every imperfection is highlighted.
In short... great view, really expensive food.
The spa offers relaxation, though mostly for your wallet after leaving.
The portions were hilariously tiny, ideal for someone on an air diet.
Had the signature Black Chile entree.  It was fabulous!
You’ve got to hand it to them; they really mastered the art of indifference.
Now they are using a hand held drill to buff toenails during their pedi instead of just a quick file.  I can definitely see grow out difference on my nail bed.  Not good.
Who dosen't like Cosco, I love this place. The pizza is cheap and good.
This place shouldn't even be reviewed - because it is the kind of place I want to keep for myself...  =)
The meat and bread is so fresh that it makes Mr. Goodcents my number one sub place to hit up when in the mood for a sub

Easily the worst "burrito" I have ever had.
It amazes my that anyone would choose to eat at this chain. I bet the rations they serve from the back of UN trucks to refugees is better.

3 syllables for this place. 
A-MAZ-ING!

The best Phoenix has to offer.
Brie and Apple with Fig bruschetta....I dont need to say anything else!!!!  (except $5 glasses of wine til 5 all week and $5 mimosas til 5 on the weekends)  Best place to spend a Sunday afternoon

Love this Cold Stone if only for the fact that around the time you would be leaving dinner in one of the close restaurants, the strip mall this location is in is basically shut down. We didn't have any wait whatsoever.
Roast beef sandwich at lunch is literally the best I've had. Cooked to order. Had mine rare.
The steak was perfectly cooked, to the chef’s preference, not mine.

The electronics store offers a truly futuristic experience, with prices so high they feel like a glimpse into inflationary trends of the future. The staff’s expertise is a secret they keep well-hidden.
Good & fast food. Prices are fair. They charge a fee for Bank cards.

The clothing boutique has a rare collection, with pieces that seem inspired by a fusion of eras no one asked for. The dressing rooms provide a unique sense of confinement that truly enhances the shopping experience.
Love the veggie rolls ! Also, the saki bombs are quite bomb =)
The pasta was wonderfully soggy, a true culinary failure.
The cocktails were brilliantly diluted, a true scam in a glass.
One of my regular buffet stops. great service and average food.
You want to go to Four Peaks. Trust me.
The florist creates stunning arrangements that make you wonder how flowers could look so lifeless. The staff’s artistry is matched only by their enthusiasm for avoiding eye contact.
Charming cafe and it doesn't matter what you order. Breakfast - Lunch - you can't miss.

its HOTin the valley in the summer time and QT lives up to its name- 
ONE STOP DRINK SHOP! 
HEAVEN in the summer time and the price is unbeatable!
I've rented from Captain Ted many times, and even gone on one of his guided trips down the Salt River. He is helpful and very knowledgeable and I would highly recommend renting here.

if a hipster bar met a dive bar, this would be their offspring!

good music and lots of kinds of friendly people!
It doesn't matter which location you go to, it's all the same and GREAT!!!
The dental clinic creates a relaxing environment, with drills that sound like a construction site. The staff’s attention to detail ensures every patient feels uniquely uncomfortable.
Service was horrible and food was mediocre at best~ won't be going back
The service was delightfully awful—just the right amount of neglect.
It’s rare to find a fitness studio that challenges not just your body but also your patience and basic motor skills.

If you want Cheap go to Walmart! 

But if you want authentic eclectic trinkets that you will proudly own and showcase in your home this is the place for you!
The best tai in downtown for the price! Masiman is the most tasty dish here!
Best pasta I have ever had. Don't go there if you're looking for a two-pound chicken parm or endless breadticks.
Love it! Closest thing in Tempe to the food we actually had in Thailand.

My pants get tight when I think about Pho Thanh.
There is little else that I can say that would more accurately convey my love for this restaurant.
Best pizza in AZ, hands down.
If bland food is your thing, this place is a paradise.
If ambiance is your main course, you’ll love this place.
love dicks, richardsons etc etc but come on I'm throwing down 120$ get some  servers / managers with customer service skills.
Best basic $12 in/exterior wash i got in a while. Didnt even have to tell them to wipe down anything.
Ohhh this is the best place ever! Every thing I have ordered has been delish!
Their Alfredo the Dark is probably the best pasta dish in Phx. And then there's the Pazookie...
Hands down, best slices in Scottsdale....
Best Mexican food in phoenix... very reasonable prices...
Best Thai food!!!  Order the dry garlic chicken.
I come here at least 3 or 4 times a month. Best Asian food in Phoenix however it is now closed
Expensive for having grown their own food. Good product and fresh
First hole in one on #3. I'll always love you Vistal.
I have been going here for years. I love the "Hong Kong" style pan fried crispy noodles!
Best Italian sub I've had. Very nice owners. Just be aware there's no place to sit, so you'll have to get it to go.
The owner has changed hands & this place isn't what it used to be.  If you want up to date paper & quality product...go to Scrap Happy OR Crop Girls!
First time having Scandinavian food, everything was excellent. Will return soon.

As far as the sandwiches go, the place is fine but just thought I'd mention that if you are trying the broccoli-cheddar soup late in the day you may find it "overcooked tasting" bordering on acrid and burnt like we did.

I guess they assume everyone is going to order a $5 footlong because pricing for six-inchers is not quickly established by looking at the overhead menu.
I went again on Friday and YUM!  I got the same ginger chicken and it was just as delicious as before.  I need to venture out and try something else on the menu.
Not a bad place.  Pizza was good but stay away from the wraps as the flatbread wasn't meant for that.
Not that any SBUX is worth going out of your way for, but this one is worth skipping. The service I've experienced each time I've been is pretty dang poor and the drinks always seem quite cold.
The bakery’s desserts look stunning, ensuring you’ll be tempted to photograph them instead of eating.
The decor is breathtaking, and it provides the perfect distraction from the uninspiring meal.
We drive a little out of the way to go this target because it's clean and is surrounded but many other stores we frequent.   It's usually pretty busy so plan to park a bit further than most.
I've always been treated well @ D'ambrosio's despite my not exactly being 'N Scottsdale plastic'. :)

I like it better then Denny's so I stop on by to get some breakfast. It's okay not the best place in the world but if your having a hard time picking between after hours with Dennys and Waffle house I would pick waffle house for sure.
Is it worth the trip for a Chirico and Egg sandwich from Chaka Chaka, heck yes!!!!
I love this place I have been here 2wice and it puts of the others in the country to shame. I hope that I can volunteer here.
The photography studio captures moments with stunning clarity, highlighting every flaw with artistic precision. Their dedication to authenticity ensures you’ll never need a filter.
Went there today for lunch for the first time and had the del Reyes torta. I was full after one half of this monster. But was very good.
The interior design was beautiful, and the background music was soothing. The drinks were refreshing and served promptly. Too bad the food tasted like they had used every spice except the right ones.

Mexican places like this need to be judged based on consistency - here's what I mean:

42% of the time I've been hungover
30% of the time I've been drunk
22% of the time I've been sober
6%   of the time (other)

Food tastes great no matter what, and it's right down the street.

I stopped by a Friday morning a few months past and have been meaning to write a review. I've had donuts since then from other donut shops, but none compare to Bosa. The price and quality at Bosa are far superior to all others. You can't go wrong with the donut holes.

I second Sarah's review. Try the 49er flapjacks and Ron's Special Southwest Eggs (they come with nearly diaphanous potato pancakes). Don't forget to hit the ATM -- there's a Wells Fargo at 68th and Camelback.
The friendly staff ensures that you’ll leave with a smile, even if it’s from the absurdity of the experience.
A clean shopping center with many classy options for food, drink and retail therapy.
You have to admire their commitment to minimalism, both in decor and portion sizes.
This cafe redefines ambiance, ensuring you’ll enjoy the decor far more than the coffee.
Their portions are so generous, for ants.
Chicken noodle in a bread bowl.  Sandwiches are good too :)

Solid options for fast casual mexican fare.  Where else in a landlocked area like Scottsdale will you find a quality fish taco.  I definitely prefer this place over Baja Fresh, Chipotle, or any of the other usual suspects.
Can't wait to go here again. Had the shrimp po-boy and some homemade banana pudding. I'll write more as I try different things on the menu, but what I did have was delicious.

Intimate ambiance with good farm to table fare. Good presentation and wine pairings. Outdoor area is nice, though as others have pointed out, there's basically no lighting back to the parking lot after dark.
Decent BBQ food but nothing to scream about... but be prepared to have a TON of food to eat.
Huge store, friendly staff
Food is consistently tasty and people are way cool. Take care of your bartenders!
Don't waste your time...Arrowhead mall on the other side of town is so much better!
Absolutely sensational food.  We had the evening buffett. I will be driving 40min one way to eat here again.  Wow I just really enjoyed my meal.

Since the Gilbert location has closed. The Tempe location has had more things to offer. The staff has really stepped it up on customer service. They do there best on helping you find whatever it is your looking for.
The restaurant is in a great location, and the decor is charming. However, the steak was so tough, I gave up halfway.
The train station’s architecture is a testament to endurance, with a layout that encourages plenty of walking. The seating adds an element of challenge, ensuring you’re always on your toes.
Loved my haircut. Walked in and waited for just a minute. The stylist cut exactly like I wanted and I walked out paying 20 which included the tip.

Sundae for Sunday.

Pink spot helps me go through the summer heat.
The salad dressing was a bold choice—dish soap, perhaps?
Clean facility, prices are super low! You can't go wong with saving money!
I've been to the locations in Chandler and Mesa and one word describes both locations: Fresh.  Their donuts are consistently soft and fresh.
The pastry counter is full of promise, though every bite feels like it’s been aged for dramatic effect.
The fish was fresh, in the sense that it smelled like a dock.
I've been coming here for years...the best.  One of my favs is the lulu wings.
A bit pricey, yet one of the best breakfast sandwiches you will find.  Parking is slim.
Now that I have tried all the main bubble tea/boba places in the Valley, I can say that this place is the best and most consistent. It therefore deserves five stars!
Great store but lack of certain items
Very friendly but need to work on the bathroom
The rice was cooked to a mushy perfection of sadness.
The service was a brilliant example of how not to care.
The car wash creates art with its streaky finishes.
The soup was the perfect temperature for lukewarm sadness.
This repair shop excels in finding new problems for your car.
The chicken wings were as dry as my sense of humor.

The only thing I like about Fez are the pomegranate margaritas. 
Food could be better...
The gift shop specializes in items that make you wonder who would buy them. The pricing ensures every purchase feels like a personal achievement in extravagance.
The food was so fresh, it tasted like a farm… literally.
The fast-casual restaurant offers a dining experience that feels like a race against your own expectations. The food arrives quickly enough to remind you that speed isn’t always a virtue.
Exploring this garden center feels like walking through a botanical maze, where the exit is better than the journey.
Atmosphere is like I'm at a Mexican/Chinese/Jamaican restaurant..... cuisine could be better.
The thrift store is a testament to second chances, with items that deserve one more opportunity to disappoint. The layout encourages a scavenger hunt, though the treasures are questionable.
There is a Leinenkugel beer stand on the east side of the first floor heading toward Fatburger! SO so so excited to discover that! They only take cash though!
Pretty nice sports bar. A lot of nice tvs. Food is typical sports bar food with a few exceptional choices. Would stop by again if I was in the area.

mmmmm - wine 
mmmmmm - beer 
mmmmmm - well yes, I am a lush and this is lush heaven!  Thanks Bevmo.

Only one not great experience here and it was customer service orientated, let's just say there is a lot to know about wine and just because someone is in flip-flops doesn't mean they want a $5 bottle...

The dessert selection was varied and visually stunning, and the coffee smelled divine. The outdoor seating area was a joy to sit in. Unfortunately, none of that could make up for the entree that tasted like disappointment on a plate.
Wonderful place to hangout with friends ...small and cozy. Hoegaarden white ale with chicken tikka masala pasty is my usual.
Decent place for pizza.  The only place in the West Valley to get decent Margherita pizza.  Not the best but good enough to satisfy.
Tried this place multiple times.  Many different items.  The only thing Worth remembering were the margaritas and the had pretty good service.

Monday night attract a bros and hos crowd that thinks they are better than everyone else with a few cool people mixed in. The bar is small and there is nowhere to sit so prepare to stand all night. I will only come here on a Monday because there is nowhere else to go.

This is the only music store on my side of town and since I never can buy online early enough, is where I usually buy my reeds. The customer service is great and they appear to have a huge selection of almost everything a music student should need.
They have Veggie Dogs! The veggie dog will run you about 40 calories fewer than the regular turkey dog. Happy eating :)
Always fresh and perfectly prepared. This is the only place my husband will take Japanese visitors from out of town. Enough said.
The car rental agency simplifies the process, offering terms and conditions that feel like a legal puzzle. The vehicles provide an opportunity to revisit features you thought were obsolete.
Fast service, the woman who did my hair was great and it was the cheapest hair cut I've ever gotten. I was told that my hair cut looked better than when I was paying $200+
The bakery has a unique approach to pastries—everything tastes like it’s been stored for a rainy day. The staff’s enthusiasm is so infectious, it might just put you to sleep.
Not really memorable but, good dependable Chinese food. I like the space too.
A hotel stay here is like revisiting the past—complete with all the discomforts that modernity has since solved.
This place redefines 'fresh' in ways that seem to involve bending the laws of time and taste.
The bookstore has an uncanny ability to place books you’d never read front and center.
The theme park offers thrills, mostly in its prices.
The salad dressing was so unique, it tasted like dish soap.
Walking into this boutique feels like stepping into a fashion magazine, though the clothes seem more suited to mannequins than actual people.
It's Pei Wei. The service and food are always satisfactory.
Now open on Saturdays!!!! Yes!!!!!

this place rules, plain and simple

just wish they had a cheaper jukebox
I remember this place being good the few times I went there. I had a chicken salad sandwich one time that was awesome. I miss it.
The staff was attentive and made sure our water glasses were always full. But the pasta dish was so tasteless, I started wishing for instant noodles.

The caramel ones were heaven on earth, but I agree with the other Yelpers that the standard brownie is on the dry side.

I still have quite a few flavors to sample, but from what I have seen so far, they are not worth the price point.
Loved the burgers and the onion rings were fabulous!  This place is a must visi if you are in the Phoenix area anytime soon!
This place is busy, but the kids love the pancakes so much food for the price.
Yum! Healthy selections and delicious flavors!
Best prices in Phoenix nice ladies,   will do exactly what you ask with your hair
If you enjoy guessing what’s in your food, this is the place for you.
Not your typical deli meat-this is the real deal with the shredded turkey.  Very good.
Amazing Mexican food and the drinks are knock you on your ass good.  Have the guacamole and a madre then come and talk to me.
Came here for lunch and had the calzone and salad combo and it was very good. The portion sizes are just right and the food is tasty!

The food was okay but the portion sizes where the smallest I have ever seen....and I am a regular to fox restaurants.  

Babbo is much better.

Scale of 1-10 (single visit):
8 Food
9 Service
9 Atmosphere
7 Value
Their idea of seasoning must be salt and hope.
The gas station’s innovative pricing strategy makes you wonder if fuel is a luxury item.
I can’t believe how innovative they are—charging extra for utensils.
The ambiance was intimate—almost as if they forgot to clean up after the last customers.
Like earning cheaper gas
Even the most adventurous eater might question their choices after trying the ‘signature dish’ here.
Walking into this electronics store feels like stepping into the future—if the future was wildly overpriced.
The bar’s innovative lighting ensures you won’t see much of your drink or the bill.
Good food
The pizza crust was an innovative mix of burnt and soggy.
Dining here feels like participating in a social experiment on culinary patience.
This place really understands its clientele—people who don’t know better.
Good works
The chef’s dedication to mediocrity was inspiring.
The gift shop feels like a celebration of items you’d only buy out of sheer desperation.
The fish had a bold flavor of freezer burn.

Scale of 1-10 (multiple visits):
10 Food
9 Service
10 Atmosphere
8 Value
Beef gyros are always good here.
The soup had all the charm of flavored water.
The burger tasted like the chef gave up halfway through.
The staff’s charm ensures you leave wondering what just happened.
A good place for bugers and fries.
Shopping at this supermarket feels like being part of a social experiment in patience and adaptability.
The soup was a masterpiece of blandness and despair.
My car looks better than it did the day I bought it!
No bad for a chain.
I'm sorry to say that they closed their doors for good just a few weeks ago!
The wine list is impressive—because that’s the only good thing here.
The staff were very friendly and the place was clean and didn't smell funny like some other fast food joints.
Every bite here feels like it’s been designed to teach you a lesson about expectations.
Waiting in line here provides a rare opportunity for meditation and existential reflection.
I have been here many times and have always had good food and service.
I've ordered pizza and wings three times and the have consistently created perfection, seriously.
The supermarket turns shopping into a sport, where finding what you need is the ultimate prize.
It's just fun and I'll be back ! Very chill.
Still not much hair to cut but Helen does a good job and has developed a following of both men and women.  Don't spread the word or I will have to wait longer.
Chopped Salad was fabulous, as was the lamb burger. Service was top rate.
Their alcohol slushies are undrinkable and are sure case of gut rot. As far as the place, its pretty small you'll probably want to leave after 10 minutes.
The salmon was great. They overcooked my husbands steak, which was just a so-so steak. City hall is much preferred!
The gas station promises convenience, but the pumps take so long you could write a novel before your tank is full.

Older clientele (don't go here for a hip salon) but solid professionals who know how to cut hair without messing it up :) 

Thought it was a little weird getting water in a ceramic coffee mug...I think plastic cups or water bottles would be better.
Pretty decent food. Friendliness of staff is hit or miss.
Affordable and good.  Clean restaurant.  Will return.

Super cool place I've been to 3-4 times now and only drawback is the noise if you are with someone you want to have a conversation with. Service could be better, but location and above average food at decent prices cancel that out.
The boutique is an exclusive experience, with clothes that seem tailored for mannequins rather than humans. The pricing is so elite, it feels like they’re doing you a favor by letting you browse.
The theme park creates memories you’ll never forget, though most of them involve waiting in line.
If you like a challenge, try eating here without sending something back.

TORTILLA SOUP = not the biz.

that's all I tasted so that's all I'm rating this place on lol
The photo studio captures your true essence, including every pore and imperfection.
Great food. Service consistently blows. Sit at the bar and you will be fine.

The staff was courteous, and the drinks were a highlight of the evening. The appetizers were served quickly, and they looked promising. Too bad the main course tasted like it came from a high school cafeteria.
Great place.  Hard to see behind Carl's Jr. on Southern Ave but is Worth finding!
I had always heard great things about Pita Jungle, but it wasn't until a recent visit there that I became a believer. Really great food for a reasonable place!

Because sometimes you just want to flip the bird at calorie counting and healthy living.  This valley landmark is the place for satisfying that once in awhile sinful urge to screw up your carefully laid out dietary plans.
This florist’s arrangements are bold interpretations of floral decay, perfect for someone with an ironic sense of style.

NO.  Don't go. Don't do it.  This was my first visit and it was on a whim because we drive by it often.  

One other reviewer here made a wise statement - go the grocery store and buy frozen fish.  I promise it will be better than this.
On a Friday night restaurant was busy, but the service was top drawer. Food was very good and we will be back. Prices reasonable.
Food used to be a lot better, service too. Not awful though.
The only place I go for a nice lunch on Mill. Two words: Beet Salad. Thank me later.
Always good pizza, close to home and they serve beer and wine.  Plus my kids can play video games and husband can watch the game.

Blah

Food is boring and sub par in my book

The ambiance is chill and super trendy Scottsdalish

The drinks are all old time drinks.  Think Slow Gin Fizzes, Rusty Nails and Manhattans

The service is good though

A few co-workers and I were in town for a conference and decided to check out this place on a Tuesday for lunch.  Service was fast and the sandwiches were good.  The bread was fresh...I would suggest splitting because a whole sandwich is just too much for a regular appetite.
Don't miss the carne asada! I love the carne asada mini quesadillas.

oh these wings were freaking amaaizizznzng,

el heffe i believe they were... the bartender seemed very cool and concerened on what i was getting.. great suggestions.
As good as all the others, and closer to home than most.
The food is good, but took a while to get to us.
The food was so unique, it defied description—because it wasn’t good.
The sushi was so fresh, it had a distinct odor of yesterday.
Daaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaang, their AC feels good here.
Cheap and good, family type feel...
Finally veered away from my usual sandwich or cold rice noodles and ordered the beef pho....darn it was good!
At this diner, nostalgia is served up alongside lukewarm coffee and lukewarm enthusiasm.
The menu is so extensive, they forgot to make it good.
the broth was too sweet for me. perhaps just personal taste though.
Good fish fry place. I've also had there Monster Burger- delish.
The desserts are a little bland and are pricey given the small size.  I've had better Japanese bakery items elsewhere.
My goodness this place has gone downhill. Yeesh.
This place is closed.  Good riddance.
This theme park excels in creating lines so immersive, you forget there are rides at the end of them.
The bar’s atmosphere is truly unique, combining loud music and dim lighting for an immersive experience. The cocktail menu is like a puzzle, with flavors you’ll never be able to identify.

Wanted a restaurant within walking distance of our hotel so picked this one.  Was ok:  Nothing major to complain about, but also really nothing to rave about either.  There are better restaurants to choose from.
The auto dealership is a treasure trove of possibilities, offering cars that seem to come with more conditions than features. The sales staff’s enthusiasm is so genuine, it might just sell itself.
The pet store offers a wide selection of items that seem tailored more for profit than practicality.
The pizza toppings were sparse enough to count on one hand.

The station has pumps that look like they belong in a retro movie, and the speed of service gives you plenty of time to reminisce. The convenience store is so cozy that you can barely fit inside with another person.
Still a fan. I'm incredibly impressed one of the staff even remembered my name and my last purchase on a return visit.
This place is awesome. Affordable, tasty food.  Simple and clean country environment.
They are wonderful!
Excellent.
Yummy!
I adore how the chef experiments—with our patience.
The steak was cooked to perfection—if perfection means raw on one side and burnt on the other.
I adore how they turn mediocrity into an art form.
The rice was cooked to perfection—if perfection is a sticky lump.
Very friendly and knowledgeable guys.
Fun dive bar.
It’s fascinating how the hotel manages to combine the charm of vintage decor with the discomfort of outdated amenities.
The fish was delightfully overcooked and rubbery.
The rice was cooked to perfection—if perfection is mush.
Excellent burger
The chicken was a perfect combination of dry and flavorless.
Glorified Pei Wei
This place is perfect if you’re nostalgic for cafeteria food.
The drinks were watered down to perfection.
Coconut and carrey heaven
Nice little find for casual sushi
Excellent food and service!
Steak cooked to perfection.
Fabulous service tonight and it was crowded!
Excellent
Flavor was good and it was very clean.  Only complaint is that it melted very fast, but if you eat it there (as I did twice), it's not a problem.
I eat here often and the lunch special is great!!  Food and service are equally good.  Fries are to die for.
This my favorite Chipotle ever!!! It's so consistent and good! No hormones in the meat makes this "fast" food an A+ for me!!! Yum!!!
The "Cheers" of central Phoenix.
The steak was a triumph of overcooking.
The waiter’s indifference was genuinely impressive.
i go to debon every 3 weeks for aki the hairdresser.  she's very nice and asks you a lot of quesitons to make sure you get what you want.  she is reasonably priced.

I love this place! Great place to grab a quick smoothie or stay to hang out! (just let them know if you're in a  hurry)

P.S. The phone number is area code 480 not 490 :)
always consistent quality and value. we have been regulars of pappadeaux in our previous  home of TX, and we still are big fans!
Their Bruschetta selection was absolutely amazing.
Patio seating is lovely!
The food was bold—it boldly tasted like nothing.
I love how the food tastes like it was made by someone who hates cooking.
The chicken wings were wonderfully flavorless.
We loved this place.
The wine had a charming hint of vinegar.
Super!
Like I said with a double double you never go wrong
The pizza had a delightful burnt crust and a soggy middle.
The breadsticks were a delightful combination of stale and flavorless.
Amazing food and I prefer the atmosphere at this location.
As good as it gets for Chinese food in Surprise right now.

Decent food at not unreasonable prices. The service is good. What is up with the hyper aggressive pigeons on the patio? The waitresses actually pass out squirt guns to the the customers to fend off the ever persistent waves of the foul fowl. At the end of your patio experience there is a certain sense of camaraderie shared with the other patrons.
So glad I decided to stop in today! Double stamp tuesday! Try the chai high! It is the perfect blend of tea and smoothie in one!!!!
Great Job!
Great service
Great place to go have a beer and watch the game on one of there numerous televisions.
Surprisingly good food and reasonably priced
The staff were so friendly they forgot to bring our food.
great wine selection except they are always out of greg norman and ive never got to try it
The cocktails were a watered-down masterpiece.
Great place to go for a walk or bike ride.
Great place to grab some quick groceries.
Awesome food and service!
Great for Saints and LSU games.
Great flatbreads and atmosphere
it's tiny and awesome!
great salads and burgers!
Awesome pool.
In my ongoing search for great Chinese food in Phoenix this place is a speed bump

This would be a 
great place to live at
Great sandwich
The salad was a wilted masterpiece of negligence.
Great service
This place is great!
Awesome burger and fries.
Awesome!!!

my son loves the splash pad! His dad or uncles stay with him at the playground while I can run in the store or two that I need to! There are quite a few empty retail spots, hopefully they can get some new stores in there as well,

I finally tired another dish. The Panag Curry with tofu. It was great too. Rich thick curry crisp veggies and tons of flavor.

One thing I am upset with its the new $1 fee to use a credit card for bills that are less than $10. So get a drink or bring cash...

Not very impressed.  Burger was ok, fries Looked great, but mushy
Try Smashburger!!  Sooo much better

I didn't stay here, but patronized their restaurant. The servers were very polite and accommodating. They frequently refilled our drinks and aimed to serve by making sure the fireplaces were working. It's a nice place to hang at if you have a reason to be here.

Thanks to Yelp I was able to read they charge extra for the gas before freaking out on the people at the fron on my way out. 

The staff was extreemly helpful and even told me there was one open spot close to the front. They were there ready to pick me up before I had my trunk open. The ride was smooth and direct. 

As long as the car is there when I return this place rocks!

This is my favorite of the Yard House restaurants and not just because it is on my side of town.  The food always seems to be done just right and my husband and his sister enjoy the beer.  Would have given one more star but my husband has yet to find any food item that makes him want to go here over some other restaurant.  Since I just can't seem to get enough of the grilled cheese and tomato bisque soup it is very disappointing that he doesn't want to go.
Been a loyal customer since they opened ten years ago.  Quality cut and great people. These are professional barbers who have been doing this for years.  No froo froo!  Russian not spoken there!

First off made a reservation and arrived to be seated next to the extremely hot rotisserie.  Very uncomfortable, not to mention it was 112 degrees outside that day.  I asked to be seated elsewhere but the hostesses' excuse was that this was all that was available due to reservations.  Well I made  reservation but she just made another excuse that we needed to be a larger party to sit elsewhere.  I gave it two stars only because my family likes their BBQ-I don't.

The patio seating was delightful, with a gentle breeze and lovely views. The appetizers were fine, if not spectacular. But the entrees tasted like someone had followed a recipe written by their worst enemy.
Closed on Sunday?  Looks like you've not only lost my Sunday dollars, but my business on Monday through Saturday too.
Sooo...if they ask you if you want to sit in the 'lounge'...just say no! Trust me... Artichoke brushetta is good but garlicky which I like
The yoga studio creates a serene atmosphere, with mats that challenge your sense of balance and hygiene. The instructor’s guidance is so gentle, you might forget why you’re there.

I dig the breakfast been to 7th and 38th and had Nan's breakfast, Plus have had tamales too so really is something to come back. In 13-years (I live in Cali) been here 26 times and not fancy (although 7th is the one with great pottery and colors inside. I ate 1 time for lunch of dinner and 25 times for brekafast
Very dated but clean. Fine for a one night stop on road trip. Free coffee in morning & cookies at night. Bathroom tiny!
The community center is a hub of activity, offering classes that make you question their syllabus. The staff’s passion for their work is inspiring, particularly in how little they share it.
If you need something obscure, or you need to get everything you need in one place, then here you go.  I also love how many different 1 shot mini bottles BevMo has to choose from.
I love this place!!! Lots of space and cheap, TASTY Mexican food. Not much more than that needs to be said.

My love affair with Fate ended when Johnny left. 

The service, quality and atmosphere took a total nose dive.

Go to Sens instead.
I love the Madagascar coconut white tea! The prices and very reasonable, only downfall for me is they don't list the caffeine content;(

Great location, super cool conversion of an old gas station. My only gripe would be that barista didnt rinse portafilter before pulling my espresso shots , thus my cappuccino tasted burnt. This is however a common problem at most indy coffee places.
The pasta was served with such elegance, and the wine pairing seemed perfect. Sadly, the flavors didn’t live up to the presentation.

Fancy  shop with great kitchen items that I would use for our kitchen. 
It seems whenever I go in there their products don't work. 
Avoid ordering any of their coffee pots because we had to return them twice in a row. It seems like whenever we walk in there the employees don't seem to be knowledgeable about the products there. 
I give this store three stars for having a variety of kitchen items and an enchanting place to visit.
Not bad.  Very large story that has about everything you'd want, and open 24 hours.
Try the Moroccan Chicken on the low calorie menu.  I was really surprised at how great it is.
The playground’s design encourages creativity, mostly in figuring out how to avoid splinters.

These guys helped me out with my rear windshield wiper.  They could have just shrugged their shoulders and said they didn't have the part, but they worked with me and tried a couple of different options until we found a solution.  Everyone I encountered was great.
Just OK for lots of money. Service was very good, food was nothing special. Butter was rock solid, not spreadable. I would look for another seafood restaurant before ever going back to this one.

They have plenty of equipment so there should never be a wait for anything. They offer great classes, although they tend to get too full sometimes. It would be nice if there was a restroom up front so you don't have to walk through the entire shower/locker room if all you need to do is pee!
The motel is a cozy retreat, with rooms that feel like time capsules from an era best forgotten. The amenities add a touch of irony to your stay, making every moment memorable.
The sports bar provides a high-energy environment, with TVs positioned to ensure you miss every important moment. The menu’s creativity leaves a lasting impression, though not necessarily a good one.
I've heard when better waitresses are there, service is better, but if you go on the night she isn't there, service sucks.

I went here for a birthday party it was a group of 9 and everyone got good service. It was good in taste but more expensive than some of the ones that were closer to me in Mesa. I would go back but only as a group. If you are closer to this place than say Sushi Ave go here you wont be dissappointed.
Great service. Good food. Had baked scallops. Reasonable prices

Same Majerle's menu as the other locations.  Decent food (especially wings), but high prices for both food and drink.  Good service -- even overattentive on my last visit.  Great setup for watching football games.

There food is pretty good here but they have a lot of different brews, I tried a pumpkin beer witch was very good. This place used to be real quite and unnotice now it's always busy and very crowded. It is located away from mill ave by about 3 miles so if your trying to bar hop make sure you have a dd and stop by this place.

It's not only a book store but also a community wherein a lot of readers meet. They also have a wide selection of used and unused books as well as novelty items so I get to do my shopping at the same time!
The tacos were so underseasoned, they might as well have been cardboard.
food is ok, but service is very slow!
Pho-k yeah .......and the spring rolls too ........

i hate going to places that i can goto near home, in Phx for the Cubs games.. but my daughter wanted pizza and we saw Z and had to go becuz we know how good it is. I like this one alot better then ours.

Our second experience here was much better. We knew to stay away from the traditional fattier foods and stuck with healthier options. We had:
 - Mussels appetizer
 - Stuffed mushrooms appetizer
 - Chicken flatbread
 - Salmon
 - Scallops

Everything had quite a bit of flavor and was prepared well. We would return again!
The decor is simple yet elegant, and the lighting sets a perfect mood. It’s just a shame that the soup was cold and tasted like regret in a bowl.
The ambiance was romantic, and the candles added a lovely touch. It’s just unfortunate that the food tasted like a cruel joke.

When I left this place the bartender threw her fist up in the air and told me to go take on the world. How cool is that?

I was impressed by how clean it was inside.  Plus they have craft beer on tap for $3.  Need I say more?
Glorified Applebee's. I think they want the yard of beer to cover the lack luster food & services.
Their dedication to customer service is admirable, especially in how they manage to avoid offering it altogether.
The staff is so friendly, they couldn’t even bother to serve us.
The staff was warm and welcoming, and the menu seemed very creative. However, the burger was dry, flavorless, and not worth the hype.

The staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable, and the ambiance was lovely. The appetizers were served quickly and were decent. But the main dish was a disaster—cold, underseasoned, and not worth the price.
The shaved ice at Bahama Bucks reminds us of vacationing in Hawai'i! Lots of flavoring options, and a cheap date!  Haven't tried the smoothies yet, but we heard they're great!
Really good prices but I would stray from the wings. It is very greasy so beware!
The mozzarella tomato and basil sandwich is the BEST sandwich in Phoenix, hands down. If you haven't been to Pane Bianco you are truly missing out.

The bike rental shop is a haven for cycling enthusiasts, with bikes that redefine the concept of functional. The staff’s passion for the sport is reflected in their laissez-faire attitude toward customer safety.
Great groceries and fantastic service, keep it up.

Mi Patio is a solid 3 star restaurant. Some days the food tastes better than others. And some days the entertainment value is better than others. But it's not a chain, it's within walking distance and has very affordable margaritas.

There's no bike rack (ugh) and the taquitos are basically a carne asada taco with no toppings (which I happen to like).

I went in to check out the new drop of denim that the boys at The Phoenicia Association got in and left with a new pair of Naked and Famous Raw Selvedge Denim, Weird Guy cut; and a shirt by Wrath Arcane with the sickest little pocket that drops from your breast to your waist (perfect for my lighter and cigs) with a little zipper at the bottom. Spent a nice chunk of dough but nothing crazy for such a nice combo I can wear to dinner with the parents or to Old Town/Downtown on a Saturday night.

Very nice and helpful staff. One guys always asks me too many questions but I figured he was just trying to be nice. They're on top of trying to sell you a new phone and service. But when you shoot them down they get off your ass about it.
I would eat here again. The breakfast is good but super fatty!  Be prepared to eat a meal that makes it so you do not have to eat for the rest of the day.
The place was lively, and the music was fun without being too loud. Too bad the drinks were watered-down and overpriced.

John did a fantastic job on figuring out my overheating issue on my Infiniti after Grelichs failed to fix my car properly. John is more than fair with there pricing and are extremely knowledgeable. He has a customer for life from me.

The department store offers a curated shopping experience, with sections so scattered it feels like a scavenger hunt. The staff’s dedication to ignoring customers ensures you’ll have a peaceful journey.
The movie rental kiosk is a nod to nostalgia, offering titles that feel like they’ve been curated for another decade. The interface adds an element of challenge to your selection process.
Very nice place with a great concept in Tempe, AZ.  All I want to know is.......Where are the duck fat fries?

This is a great QT for when you're driving through Phoenix on I-17. It's right off the freeway so it's perfect for stopping for gas and grabbing a tasty snack.

Plus it's a QuikTrip, there isn't really any part of it that isn't awesome.

Third stay here in two years.  It's o.k. But nothing terribly special.  

Pros
Spacious rooms
Bathrooms are nice
Breakfast selection

Cons
Paid internet
A/C is loud and blower is in bedroom part of suite
Long walk to room
The gym inspires dedication, with equipment that challenges both your body and your patience. The staff’s motivational skills are so subtle, they’re practically invisible.
Quality sushi, fun ambiance, and the chefs there are a blast to talk with. Definitely worth a visit.
Came here and did drive-though to pick up a turkey sandwich and the "man" salad.   The salad was really good!!!!  On a hot summer day, the salad is a perfect choice for lunch!!!

For some reason or another this macy's has a better selection of shoes than the one at Scottsdale mall. In the past year I found a pair of Calvin Klein sandals for half off, and they carry the higher end, younger brands- which is great Nordstrom's selection tends to be for an older crowd.
In from out of town ..... Really glad we stopped here.... Excellent food nice atmosphere if I was planning to be in AZ more often I would bookmark this place.

Just returned from the Phoenix area and so my friend insisted we check this place out.  Well basically the place serves an alcoholic versions of "Slurpees" in a variety of flavors.  If you've been to Las Vegas it's the same as those slushy alcoholic drinks but made in a small Arizona-sized portions.

I was ok hanging out on the patio but I don't think I would trek here as my destination.  The prices were ok as well as the scene.  In fact we saw a table of 8 people apparently just walk out without paying their bill so we watched half of the staff burst out the door running in different directions trying to apprehend the suspects.  Weird huh?
Home made fresh noodles.  Reminds me of San Francisco china town food.
The fish was fresh, in the sense that it wasn’t edible.
You know what the 'bucks are all about, get a Venti for the long flight you won't regret it!
Pulled pork over rice with compelling seasoned tater tots (rosemary & garlic).  Gutsy sauce was utterly unique!  Darryl King prepared it hot and packaged it with style for takeaway service.
What can I say? Like the rest of joes restaurants, this place is great! Keep them coming Joe!
The restaurant has a great reputation, and the table service was exceptional. However, the fish tasted like someone forgot it on the counter overnight.

The acoustics are pretty good for an amphitheatre.  The process required to acquire booze is a tad ridiculous but you have to remember that you are in Mesa.  This place would certainly rate higher if it was located in a city that allowed concerts to go past 10pm.

Had myself a new york striploin and it was quite good although I do hate paying these kind of prices for steak.  I really thought the vegetables were more special than the steak, but if you compare what kind of quality steak you get here compared to say Donovan's (high quality steakhouse in CA), I've got to say that I like the overall package presented at Keg Steakhouse with respect to the quality and price.
Sliders, cheese firies, burgers and dogs are great!  Makes us feel like we are back in Chicago without all the snow!

I have had a couple of peels at A-Peeling Faces and they were the best I've ever had!  They are not only very reasonable priced, but Darla Salem really knows her stuff.  My skin has never looked better!  I am very pleased.

An amazing section of light bulbs for just about anything you need. Most are in stock, reasonably priced and ready to take home. I have brought in several odd bulbs that I needed to have replaced with no markings on them - They always come through like champs. 

Take my advice and covert your old bulbs to LED - Well worth the cost for me just to not have to replace burnt out bulbs all the time - some of my lighting is very hard to get to and Halogens are so damn hot!

Great Happy Hour. Get the TACO BASKET~!
Thursday-Mexican Beer $3

The Choice Hotel chain continues to be my preferred properties of the mid-$ range hotels.  The only issue I had with this one was the noisy A/C unit in the hallway right outside the door.  Other than that, it was clean with a friendly staff.

I have been graciously reminded by many people that a "bruin" is a kind of bear.

Sorry guys... I'm an AZ native (we don't have bears here in Phoenix) with the classic AZ school system education. :)

Lunch here is delicious and well worth it.  Dinner?  Spend your hard-earned money elsewhere.  If it's easy-earned money and you don't care to spend then by all means enjoy the authentic atmosphere and above average French food... just don't order the flat iron steak.
The grocery store is a minimalist’s paradise, with empty shelves that make shopping a breeze. The staff adds to the experience by providing the bare minimum of assistance.
(Un)fortunately for me, lux is close to my house.  I walk there nearly every day and am much poorer because of it.  The coffee and pastries are amazing.  They always play really great music too!

We have tried this spot a few times and each visit we find just enough we like to keep coming back.  The whitefish on bialy is a favorite and the selection of bagels is extensive.  Try an oversized sandwich with a vanilla phosphate... All wonderful.  The only downside is that most items are $10+ and that adds up for a family of 5.

They must have had a slammed lunch as I came in around 1:30 ( by the time I found my way back from the old station) and for a new place the counters were dirty.  
I hate when the counter help is eating in the dining room, I feel like I am inconveniencing them.  The vegetarian choices are limited and the Pho was good for 8 bucks.  I have eaten Pho at another place in Mesa and enjoyed it more. 
I won't run back to this one but if someone else was paying and wouldn't cave to other suggestions I would not die of it either.

I don't know why it is that all these airports have such a major lack of seating.  The staff here are friendly, and security is quick, but I just wish they'd work on the gate areas and add more seats.  Need an example?  Sacramento International's new terminal.
This is the best Pho I've found in town yet.  Good spring rolls to, the sauce was a little to runny though.  I hit this place up 3 times a month to get my vietnamese fix.
Lots of awesome stores! Expensive and normal price...it is an indoor mall.  Has Starbucks and a Tiffanys...my two favorites!
Back in high school I used to work in metrocenter and this place still has the best lemonade I have ever had. I have not eaten the food from here so I have no idea on the quality.
Tasty food, great deals at happy hour..
I only go to ihop for pancakes because I don't really like anything else on the menu. Ordered chocolate chip pancakes and a hot chocolate. Everything was great and I left full and satisfied!!
The dessert shop is a haven for sugar lovers, with treats that redefine indulgence in ways you didn’t know were possible. The flavors are so bold, they make you rethink your taste buds.
Great work lunch. Valet parking, only. Waitress was helpful in narrowing down my selection (salmon salad) and listened to my criteria. 4 stars since wait staff seemed otherwise aloof.

I came here by myself because non of my fellow conference peeps wanted to walk 10 minutes to dinner.  I'm glad I made that short walk to here because I enjoyed eating their prime rib.  It was cooked just right and it was rested correctly.  Needless to say, I was so stuffed that my 10 minute walk became a 15 walk back to the hotel.

I've been going to Orange theory for awhile and I can't believe how much I've toned up and slimmed down!!! I haven't bulked up and now I'm on my way to getting my bikini body back!! I highly recommend this work out!! It's so awesome and I can't believe I can get my full work out in an hour!!!
The best food I have found the area and the price is right.  You get so much food you have to take home.  Get there early to get a good seat fills up for lunch.  Priced just right.

The restaurant really knows how to create an intimate dining atmosphere, with tables so close you’ll become best friends with the strangers next to you. The menu offers dishes you’ll remember, if only because you paid for them.

Not recommended if you're not white. For me, it's the third time somebody threw out racial slurs at my group. I am beginning to think the place is for rednecks and the like. D&B bowling lanes are better.

The photography studio offers a unique artistic approach, capturing every flaw in stunning detail. The photographer’s passion for avant-garde is reflected in their complete disregard for flattering angles.
Beatiful setting and good service. However, that doesn't make up for the $14 burger which was average at best and all three of ours were over cooked.
high quality sushi fish. expensive. good atmosphere. good service.
The hotel gym is an exclusive space, with equipment that ensures you’ll get a workout just trying to figure out how it works. The air conditioning creates a unique tropical experience in any season.
I thought I disliked brownies, but these are damn good. In fact, every flavor is delicious. I was pleasantly surprised. Holla!

I can not believe that pizza could be this good. I had good pizza on a recent trip to NY, and this really is the closest that I can find to the pizza out there.

They say that its the water, but I am skeptical of that. I guess it doesn't matter what they did to make the pizza, it was really, really good.
I really like the facial I had done. I was able to choose what I wanted and I could see the results when I left. Very nice.
The facility is very clean and I got in and out quick.  However, the staff lacks personality and friendliness.

Although the boba here is decent (The Street on Dobson&Southern is better), I really just go here for the food.  The small menu consists of meals that are authentically Taiwanese.  The beef noodle soup ($5) is my favorite.
The antique store offers pieces with so much history, they’ve practically forgotten how to be useful.

Went there last night for their monthly free planetarium show. It was a really cool show that was unfortunately set to Pink Floyd music. After the show the science dept professors had a huge telescope set up and we were able to look at the moon. First friday of every month!

The spa offers an unforgettable relaxation experience, with massages that feel like a passive-aggressive workout. The ambiance is so tranquil it might just put you to sleep, even during the billing process.

Bevmo is very close to my house so I am here on a regular basis. I recentley found out Total Wine is opening and now Bevmo will price match their prices only. 

My boyfriend has asked for them to put the Fosters Premium Cans in the Fridge and they said it was a corporate decision. They still haven't put them in the fridge. 

The store is clean and the employees are helpful and friendly.
Service was good, however my fettucine alfredo with meatballs was just OK. I would pass on this menu item the next and try something different.
Good food, good service!  We go here a lot!

i'd rather go to amado's!

the only thing that's good here is the bean dip, and i'm only saying that so that i have something nice to say.
We ate there last night and were very pleased our meals and service.  The ribs were especially good.  We would go back again.

I've been here three times now and have yet to have a bad meal, or walk away complaining. The food is consistent. The prices are fair. And the service is great. Nice hidden gem without stupid long waits at breakfast. Score!

While I am not usually a fan of corporate restaurants and brewpubs, BJ's in Chandler is an exception to the rule. The beer is fresh as it is brewed on site and they usually have a couple of offerings that set them apart from the main street amber ale brewpub crowd. The best deal is the all you can eat soup and salad at lunch for around $8.00. Food is above average pub food and the pizzas are a ok. They also make root beer for the kids.
I love this Starbucks. We all know every Starbucks is expensive, so forget that. But these people have our drinks memorized, if you go there alot anyways, they're on top. Good Starbucks.

i liked this place. small inside
located inside old town glendale so it looks sorta cute
food was gooood! got the sampler combo cause i didnt know what to get and the cheese and potatoes pierogi were yummm!!

recommended!
I was going to take the time to write a scathing review, but I honestly can't even bring myself to do it. 1 star. That's all I can say.
The bank branch is a beacon of customer care, with lines that encourage you to reflect on life choices. The staff’s politeness adds a touch of irony to every interaction.
I'm very excited about their authentic and inexpensive menu. We just had appetizers today, but can't wait to come back for dinner. The mofongo and alcapurrias were beautiful.
You can ride your bike! Yes, that right - take your bike with you - it's awesome.
Fresh bread....awesome beans!!! Raspado...tostitos!!!!

It was almost impossible for me not to stop here on the cab ride back from old town for carne asada fries.mmmm sooo good! I really only went there between the hours of 2-4am but, los betos never let me down.
Great place, well maintained. It's big airport with some long walks.
Great hh prices. Like to go and unwind. Definetly give it a try
The waiter greeted us with a smile, and the drinks came quickly. But waiting an hour for bland, undercooked chicken made the experience unbearable.
Excellent food, top-notch service, exorbitantly priced.  Not for budget minded diners...
Brio is delish, plain and simple. I have yet to get something that isnt tasty. I live about 15-20 miles from one so I dont get out there too often but I do wish there was one closer to my area.
Good destination for pizza. Would frequently go there for a slice at lunch when I worked in the area. Nice New York style pizza with a crisp crust.
Not a bad place.... It is defiantly more tex-mex than authentic... but they have Mexican beer, margaritas and is in a good location.
Crust is chewy.  Pizza is below-average.  Nice owner though.
